observation: The user successfully found the word 'concatenate' on the Cambridge Dictionary site. The pronunciation is provided in both UK (/kənˈkæt.ən.eɪt/) and US (/kənˈkæt.ə.neɪt/) phonetic symbols. The definition is "to put things together as a connected series." An example sentence is: "The filename is a series of concatenated words with no spaces." Multiple example sentences from the Cambridge English Corpus are also available.
